study_metadata.name: Local_Model_Comparison_Experiment
study_metadata.description: Cost-free experiment comparing local Ollama models (Llama 3.2 vs Mistral) across diverse political speeches for moral foundations analysis
study_metadata.hypothesis: Local models provide sufficient quality for academic research while offering unlimited TPM throughput and zero operating costs, with meaningful differentiation across political content
study_metadata.research_context: Evaluate local model capabilities using real political speeches (Reagan, Obama, John Lewis) as foundation for cost-free academic research infrastructure
study_metadata.research_question: How do local Ollama models (Llama 3.2 vs Mistral) compare in moral foundations analysis of diverse political speeches (Reagan, Obama, John Lewis), and can they provide adequate capabilities for academic research without API costs or TPM constraints?
hypotheses: Local models provide consistent narrative analysis across text sizes without TPM limitations
Llama 3.2 and Mistral show distinct analytical patterns suitable for different research contexts
Local models eliminate cost barriers while maintaining research-quality analysis capabilities
Processing time for local models is acceptable for academic research workflows
success_criteria: Clear quality comparison between Llama 3.2 and Mistral models measured
Processing efficiency and throughput capabilities documented
Framework compliance and analytical consistency validated
Academic viability assessment for cost-free research infrastructure
